name: Economics
descriptions: The Economics minor builds analytical and quantitative reasoning skills applicable across many fields. Students take 18 hours including at least one intermediate-level course in microeconomics or macroeconomics.
A minimum of 12 hours must be at the advanced level (30000 or above).

courses: One of: ECON 30223 - Intermediate Microeconomics, ECON 31223 - Intermediate Microeconomics: A Mathematical Approach, or ECON 30233 - Intermediate Macroeconomics - 3 hrs.

electiveCourses.description: 15 additional hours of economics courses, with a minimum of 12 total hours at the 30000 level or above.
